defs: = ಕಿಡಿಯಿಡು.
(sparks, burning charcoal, etc.) to fall from above (as a shower).
ಕಿಡಿವೀೞ್ತರ್ kiḍivīłtar = ಕಿಡಿವೀೞ್.
to have, produce sparks.
to damage, injure or render useless; to spoil; to destroy.
to mar or impair the enjoyment, quality or functioning of.
to overindulge so as to cause to demand or expect too much.
to make ceremonially unclean or to spoil morally.
to put off or extinguish a burning lamp or fire.
to avoid (something) from happening; to ward off.
to shower sparks on.
to throw sparks off.
sparks in very large numbers (as a group or set, treated as sing.).
to be damaged or injured in such a way as to become useless, valueless, etc., esp. to decay (as food); to spoil (oneself).
to be avoided (from happening); to be warded off.
to land in a difficult condition.
to lose in a contest; to be defeated.
to lose wealth, office, status, etc.
to overstep or violate (a rule etc.).
to be lost; to be missed.
to become wicked; to be depraved.
to become morally or religiously defiled.
to cease to exist; todie.
to become blur, dull, lusterless.
to fail to achieve the target, accomplish etc.
to be extinguished; to be put off.
to damage, spoil or injure (something).
a man marked by or having a character disposed to, serious and wilful wrongdoing (as cruel and injurious acts); a wicked man.
to strike heavily as to damage or injure seriously (something).
= ಕಿಡುಕುಟ್ಟು.
= ಕಿಡಿಗೇಡಿ.
= ಕಿಡಿಗೇಡಿತನ.
to be warded off, lost gradually.
a deeply distressed, miserable or unfortunate condition.
an evil or offensive look.
any of a class of insects that is not developed.
an insignificant, worthless person.
to go bad; to turn, go sour; to become rotten; to rot; to become tainted; to decompose, to decay.
an abraded area of the skin.
a mark left in the skin by the healing of injured tissue; a scar.
that causes abrasion on the skin.
small, short, light, ringing sounds as of a very small bell; tinkle.
ಕಿಣಿಕಿಣಿ ಎನ್ನು kiṇi kiṇi ennu to make a series of small, short, light, ringing sounds like those of a very small bell; to tinkle.
a thin, transparent film on a tooth surface, containing mucin, bacteria, etc, which, if not removed, forms tartar and promotes tooth decay; plaque.
(dial.) a writer; one who lives by writing profession.
a sect in the brāhmaṇa community of Konkaṇ region.
to make a series of small, short, light, ringing sounds like those of a very small bell; to tinkle.
a tooth on the surface of which a thin film containing mucin, bacteria, etc. is formed; a plaque-tooth.
the small plant Achyranthes aspera of Amaranthaceae family, used as an astringent depurative, as a remedy in dropsy and as an antidote to the venom of scorpion.
a small cup for drinking liquids; a cup.

a musical instrument consisting of a conveniently arranged series of glasses filled with water in varying quantities from which tones are produced by striking with a stick or rod; a kind of glass harmonica.
a boy.
a substance or organism causing fermentation, as yeast, bacteria, enzymes, etc.; ferment.
dregs or sediment of fermenting wine; lees.
a vessel for making, fementing wine or any other liquor.
causing enzyme.
a microbic organism that causes enzyme.
that which is not right or not just, proper, correct, etc. esp. an unjust, unsocial or immoral act; a wrong.
to commit an offense.
= ಕಿತಾಪತಿ.
not natural; made in imitation of or as a substitute for something natural; pretended; artificial; fictitious.
a man who plays games of chance for money or some other stake; a gambler.
a man who habitually cheats; a cheat; a swindler; a deceiver.
the small shrubby plant, Datura stramonium of Solanaceae family with bright yellow flowers; datura.
a mad or crazy man.
pretended courtesy; affected politeness.
a woman who plays games of chance for money or some other stake; a gambler.
a woman who habitually cheats; a cheat; a swindler; a deceiver.
the act of meddling, interfering into another's or otherś affair without being asked to; officiousness causing annoyance to others.
a man who meddles in otherś affairs officiously; a meddlesome man.
= ಕಿತಾಪತಿ.
a descriptive name or appellation given to or received by a person for extraordinary ability, prowess, eminence, etc.; a title.
a number of sheets of paper, parchment, etc. with writing or printing on them, fastened together, between protective covers; a book.
a young man.
the number of times any action or occurrence is repeated.
a small arrow.

the lower portion (of anything).
the region below (as, region below one's feet, etc.).
intense dislike; loathing; detestation; abhorrence.
the act or an instance of cheating.
a penancing, austere religious vow.
a small foot.
a person who leads a life of contemplation and rigorous self-denial for religious purposes; an ascetic.
a priest, ascetic etc. second in hierarchy in a religious monastery.

= ಕಿತ್ತಾಡು.
a sagging, down cast head.
the state of being defeated or dejected.
the evergreen tree Citrus aurantium (= C. bergamia) of Rutaceae family; orange tree.
its reddish-yellow, round, edible citrus fruit, with a sweet, juicy pulp; an orange.

its fruit.

to engage in a strife; to quarrel.
a young man.
a sort of coarse hempen cloth; canvas.

the fiber, used to make rope, sailcloth, etc. hemp.
the perennial plant Boehmeria nivea of Urticaceae family grown in warm climates for the strong bast fiber of the stems.
its fiber, used for making cloth.
in pieces; part by part.
public estimation; fame; renown.
fame; good reputation.
to cause to pluck, pull out (something that is planted or pierced into).
= ಕಿತ್ತಲೆ2.
= ಕಿತ್ತಲೆ2.
[rightly,ಕೀೞು, p.p. of ಕೀೞು is wrongly used in the sence of its root ] to pull or pluck out (something that is planted or pierced into).
ಕಿತ್ತಿಕೊಳ್ kittikoḷ (rightly ಕಿತ್ತುಕೊಳ್) to pull out ( as one's hair); 2. to grasp or seize suddenly (without warning); to snatch; ಕಿತ್ತಿಹಾಕು kittihāku (rightly ಕಿತ್ತುಹಾಕು) to remove; to take off.

any of various painful conditions of the joints and muscles, characterised by inflammation, stiffness, etc., including rheumatoid arthritis, bursitis, and neuritis; rheumatism.
the occupation or condition of a servant.

hot displeasure; anger.
a cloth worked with silver or gold threads.
